title: Rikers Island guard stabbed in the ear by an inmate with a PEN
title_page: Rikers Island guard stabbed in the ear by an inmate with a PEN | Daily Mail Online
text:
A city correction officer was stabbed in the ear by an inmate during a routine medical assessment at Rikers Island.
Raphael Ishmail allegedly used a pen to attack the officer inside the George Motchan Detention Center on Saturday afternoon.
The officer is now facing the possibility of having permanent hearing loss in one ear following the attack.
The officer (pictured) is now facing the possibility of having permanent hearing loss in one ear following the attack
The injured man was rushed to hospital and is receiving medical treatment.
The attack represents the eighth time a member of the center's staff has been attacked by an inmate since the start of the new year.
An official department spokesman labelled the latest assault as 'unacceptable.'

'Such attacks against the hardworking men and women who serve in our department will not be tolerated,' a statement read.
Correction Officers union boss Norman Seabrook said that he believed these attacks were 'on the rise.'
